raw_comment:
Welcome to Wednesday's moderation of  “What’s Going On in This Graph?”  

Today’s graph shows the 30-year average date across the country for the first sign of spring – leaves. 

From 9 am – 2 pm E.T. today, share with us your responses online to these three questions -- "What do you notice?",  "What do you wonder?", and  "What's going on in this graph?"  

Plus, please share with us a catchy headline that captures the ideas about the graph. 

On Thursday afternoon, we’ll reveal the article that included this graph and much more.  We look forward to reading your discoveries.

The next “What’s Going On in This Graph?” will be released tomorrow -- Thursday, April 4 with moderation on Wednesday, April 10.  The topic – summer pop songs.

Also, to view the March 20 webinar about teaching with graphs from The New York Times, go tohttps://webinars.on24.com/nyt/Graphs?partnerref=OnDemand
ace_sentences: This is Wednesday's moderation of "What’s Going On in This Graph?".
Today's graph shows the 30-year average date for the first sign of spring.
The first sign of spring is leaves.
The graph covers the whole country.
From 9 am to 2 pm E.T. today, you can share responses online.
You can answer three questions.
The first question is: What do you notice?
The second question is: What do you wonder?
The third question is: What is going on in this graph?
You can share a catchy headline.
The catchy headline captures ideas about the graph.
On Thursday afternoon, we will reveal the article that included this graph.
The article includes this graph.
The article includes much more.
We look forward to reading your discoveries.
The next "What’s Going On in This Graph?" will be released tomorrow.
Tomorrow is Thursday, April 4.
The moderation will be on Wednesday, April 10.
The topic is summer pop songs.
A webinar happened on March 20.
The webinar is about teaching with graphs.
The webinar is from The New York Times.
To view the webinar, go to https://webinars.on24.com/nyt/Graphs?partnerref=OnDemand.
